cscd211Classes

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Classes.Inventory

  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a typical Inventory. An inventory contains an ArrayList of InventoryItem(s).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_ITEMS
      A constant to represent the default size of the inventory set to 5
      private java.util.ArrayList<InventoryItem> inventory
      The ArrayList of Inventory Item(s) in the inventory

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Inventory()
      Default value constructor that creates this ArrayList with a default size of 5
      Inventory(int total)
      Explicity value constructor that will create an array list of a size that is equal to total

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addInventoryItem(InventoryItem item)
      This method adds an InvenotryItem to the stores inventory.
      InventoryItem getInventoryItem(int index)
      Since we are using an ArrayList under the hood we need to know the index value of the InventoryItem we are retrieving
      The InventoryItem returned will be a deep copy
      int size()
      Returns the size of this inventory
      void sortInventory()
      Makes a call to Collections.sort passing the inventory
      void sortInventoryByPrice()
      Makes a call to Collections.sort passing the inventory and a InventoryPriceComparator object
      void sortInventoryBySKU()
      Makes a call to Collections.sort passing the inventory and a InventorySKUComparator object
      java.lang.String toString()
      Prints out each item by calling the InventoryItem(s) toString one InventoryItem per line

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_ITEMS

        public static final int DEFAULT_ITEMS
        A constant to represent the default size of the inventory set to 5
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • inventory

        private java.util.ArrayList<InventoryItem> inventory
        The ArrayList of Inventory Item(s) in the inventory

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Default value constructor that creates this ArrayList with a default size of 5

      • Inventory

        public Inventory(int total)
        Explicity value constructor that will create an array list of a size that is equal to total
        Parameters:
        total - Representing the initial size of the ArrayList
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if total is < 1

    • Method Detail

      • addInventoryItem

        public void addInventoryItem(InventoryItem item)
        This method adds an InvenotryItem to the stores inventory. This addition ensures a very deep copy
        Parameters:
        item - The InventoryItem to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the item is null

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints out each item by calling the InventoryItem(s) toString one InventoryItem per line
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String - Representing this Inventory

      • getInventoryItem

        public InventoryItem getInventoryItem(int index)
        Since we are using an ArrayList under the hood we need to know the index value of the InventoryItem we are retrieving
        The InventoryItem returned will be a deep copy
        Parameters:
        index - The index in the ArrayList to retrieve
        Returns:
        InventoryItem Representing a deep copy of value at the index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if index < 0 or index >= size

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of this inventory
        Returns:
        int - Representing the size of this inventory

      • sortInventory

        public void sortInventory()
        Makes a call to Collections.sort passing the inventory

      • sortInventoryBySKU

        public void sortInventoryBySKU()
        Makes a call to Collections.sort passing the inventory and a InventorySKUComparator object

      • sortInventoryByPrice

        public void sortInventoryByPrice()
        Makes a call to Collections.sort passing the inventory and a InventoryPriceComparator object
